headline: Factbox-How Big Tech is faring against US antitrust lawsuits
summary: (Reuters) -A U.S. lawsuit where Alphabet's Google was ordered on Tuesday to share search data with competitors is just one of the major efforts by U.S. antitrust enforcers to challenge Big Tech companies over their dominance.  Here are the statuses of the U.S. antitrust cases or probes against some of the world's most valuable companies: Alphabet's Google, Meta Platforms, Apple, Amazon, Microsoft and Nvidia.

headline: Apple AI Researcher for Robotics Joins Meta in Latest Exit
summary: The employee, Jian Zhang, joined the Meta Robotics Studio, the social media company confirmed on Tuesday.  Separately, three more AI researchers are leaving Apple’s in-house large language models team, adding to upheaval in that group, according to people with knowledge of the matter.  The latest string of departures — all taking place over the last week — includes John Peebles, Nan Du and Zhao Meng, said the people, who asked not to be identified because the moves haven’t been announced.

raw.headline: Apple AI Researcher for Robotics Joins Meta in Latest Exit
raw.summary: The employee, Jian Zhang, joined the Meta Robotics Studio, the social media company confirmed on Tuesday.  Separately, three more AI researchers are leaving Apple’s in-house large language models team, adding to upheaval in that group, according to people with knowledge of the matter.  The latest string of departures — all taking place over the last week — includes John Peebles, Nan Du and Zhao Meng, said the people, who asked not to be identified because the moves haven’t been announced.

headline: Anthropic valued at $183 bn in new funding round

headline: Big Tech Is Having Its Worst Day Since Aug. 1
summary: The Nasdaq Composite was down 1.7% on Tuesday, on track for its biggest drop since Aug. 1.  The Roundhill Magnificent Seven ETF, which includes all seven of the ETF’s titular megacap tech stocks, was down 2%, on track for its biggest decline since Aug. 1 and its lowest close since Aug. 21.  The Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund was down 2%.

The Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund was down 2%.

headline: Big Tech’s Market Dominance Stirs Debate on Concentration Risks
summary: The debate is becoming more urgent as Nividia, Microsoft, Apple Inc., Alphabet Inc., Amazon.com Inc. and Meta Platforms Inc. account for more than 30% of the benchmark index, more than three times their weighting from a decade ago.  For Scott Chronert, Citi Research’s managing director, the concentration is a badge of honor, well-deserved for a group that continues to deliver unparalleled growth in sales and earnings.

raw.headline: Big Tech’s Market Dominance Stirs Debate on Concentration Risks

headline: ‘I’ve applied for more than 5,000 jobs – it’s brutal out there’
